intro: Pentapetes tiliifolia, commonly known as the five-lobed woodbine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Pentapetes tiliifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
